summary: Wallabies are small to medium-sized animals native to Australia and New Guinea, related to kangaroos. They're found in different parts of the world now, like New Zealand and the UK, but were brought there. There are many kinds of wallabies, like brush wallabies, rock-wallabies, and hare-wallabies, each with unique features. For example, some have spiky tails, and others live mainly in rocky areas near water. Wallabies are hunted for their meat and fur.
title: Wallaby
